importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Prince Andrew stepped down from public life following a widely criticized BBC interview about his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.
Prince Andrew reached an out-of-court settlement with Virginia Giuffre in a sexual abuse lawsuit, marking a pivotal legal development in the public scrutiny of his connections to Epstein.
A tribunal hearing in December 2024 upheld a decision to bar Yang Tengbo from the UK, revealing Prince Andrew’s alleged ties to an alleged Chinese spy through business dealings.
Virginia Giuffre died by suicide at age 41 in April 2025; her posthumous memoir, described as 'unsparing,' is set to be released, adding further context to the allegations against Prince Andrew.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeline from 2015 to 2025 covers the sustained public and legal scrutiny of Prince Andrew’s relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and alleged ties to a Chinese spy, culminating in the decision to give up royal titles.

keyTakeAways: Prince Andrew formally relinquishes his royal titles, including Duke of York, citing that ongoing accusations distract from the Royal Family's work.
The decision follows decades of public scrutiny, including allegations from Virginia Giuffre that he sexually abused her at Epstein’s properties and knew she was underage.
Andrew previously faced legal and social consequences, including loss of military titles and charity positions, due to his ties with Epstein and a Chinese national, Yang Tengbo.
A tribunal in December 2024 revealed Yang Tengbo was authorized to act on Andrew’s behalf during business meetings with Chinese investors, raising concerns over national security and espionage.
Andrew will no longer attend royal Christmas events, but will retain his title as 'Prince' due to being the son of Queen Elizabeth II and will continue to reside at Royal Lodge.
His ex-wife Sarah Ferguson will no longer be referred to as Duchess of York, and his daughters Beatrice and Eugenie retain their titles.
The case has drawn national attention due to the intersection of royal privilege, sexual abuse allegations, and geopolitical security concerns involving foreign nationals.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Prince Andrew has formally resigned from using his royal titles, including Duke of York, following sustained public pressure and allegations tied to his relationships with Jeffrey Epstein and an alleged Chinese spy, Yang Tengbo. The decision, made in consultation with King Charles and Prince William, comes after a decade of scrutiny, including a 2015 sexual abuse lawsuit from Virginia Giuffre, which alleged that Andrew engaged in sexual encounters with her while aware of her underage status. Despite repeatedly denying the allegations, Andrew has lost military titles and charity roles and is now stepping back from public appearances, such as royal Christmas events. His ex-wife, Sarah Ferguson, will no longer be addressed as Duchess of York, while his daughters retain their titles. A tribunal in 2024 confirmed Yang Tengbo’s authorization to represent Andrew in business dealings with Chinese investors, raising national security concerns. Virginia Giuffre’s death in April 2025 and the upcoming release of her posthumous memoir further intensify scrutiny, highlighting the intersection of royal privilege, sexual abuse, and geopolitical risk.
title: Prince Andrew gives up royal titles after string of scandals
